info.title: How to use ignore-me
info.subtitle: Generator for ignoring files for Autotools based projects

abstract.para: ignore-me is a generator for ignoring files for autotools based projects and it knows how to handle autoconf, automake, libtool, gtk-doc, gnome-doc-utils, yelp.m4, mallard, intltool, gsettings, dejagnu, appdata, appstream.

chapter.para:
For building and running ignore-me you need:
xsltproc (for the manpage)
python3
itstool
This section describes, how to install ignore-me for Ubuntu, Debian or openSUSE.

sect1.para: The installation works in the console/terminal via (with &rootuser;): &prompt.root;sudo apt install ignore-me and press Enter (in unstable).

Do the following to get ignore-me get work:
Type in the console (as &rootuser;): &prompt.root;sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ignore-me/ppa and press Enter.
Now type: &prompt.root;sudo apt update && sudo apt install ignore-me and press Enter.
To install ignore-me on openSUSE, follow the next steps (as &rootuser;):

step.para: Type &prompt.root;sudo zypper ar https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/saigkill:/ignore-me/openSUSE_Leap_42.2 for Leap 42.2 and press Enter.
Type &prompt.root;sudo zypper ar https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/saigkill:/ignore-me/openSUSE_Leap_42.3 for Leap 42.3 and press Enter.
Type &prompt.root;sudo zypper ar https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/saigkill:/ignore-me/openSUSE_Tumbleweed for Tumbleweed and press Enter.
Then type &prompt.root;sudo zypper ref && sudo zypper in ignore-me and press Enter.

sect1.title: Generic Installation
sect1.para: For all other distros are the following steps proposed:

step.para: &prompt.user;tar -xf ignore-me-&VERSION;.tar.xz
&prompt.user;cd ignore-me-&VERSION;
&prompt.user;./configure
&prompt.user;make
[ Become root if necessary ]
&prompt.root;make install

chapter.para: ignore-me defines some common tasks for your Makefile.am. Now following the VCS specific steps to use ignore-me.

step.para: Change inside the shell to your project's root directory.
Type &prompt.user;copy-bzrmk and press Enter.
Type &prompt.user;make -f bzr.mk and press Enter.

note.para: The copy command modifies all Makefile.am files and includes itself there. This enables automatic .bzrignore generation.

step.para: Define a BZRIGNOREFILES variable into your Makefile.am and add the files who should be ignored.

Add to MAINTAINERCLEANFILES in your Makefile.am:
$(BZRIGNORE_MAINTAINERCLEANFILES_TOPLEVEL)
$(BZRIGNORE_MAINTAINERCLEANFILES_MAKEFILE_IN)
$(BZRIGNORE_MAINTAINERCLEANFILES_M4_LIBTOOL)

chapter.para: If you need to ignore more files, add them to the BZRIGNOREFILES, GITIGNOREFILES, HGIGNOREFILES, SVNFILES or CVSFILESvariable in your Makefile.am.

But think twice before doing that. If a file has to be in a .xxxignore, chances are very high that it's a generated file and should be in one of MOSTLYCLEANFILES, CLEANFILES, DISTCLEANFILES, or MAINTAINERCLEANFILES.
The only case that you need to manually add a file to XXXIGNOREFILES is when remove files in one of mostlyclean-local, clean-local, distclean-local, or maintainer-clean-local make targets.
